ygData.subject: Re: [archive-crawler] encoding issue with ARCWriterProcessor?

Tell us more.

Heritrix writes the raw captured bytes untampered.

What are you using to view the ARCWriterProcessor captures?  The page 
you point to in the below does not explicitly state its encoding.  
Perhaps it needs this hint to rendor the pages properly? For example,  
if I force my browser to render the page using ISO-8859-1 rather than 
UTF-8, I see the mangling you reproduce below.

St.Ack



Holger Lausen wrote:
> Hi all,
>
> using heritrix 1.2:
>
> When using the org.archive.crawler.writer.ARCWriterProcessor in the
> default profile on e.g. http://www.atcomp.cz/webservices/dokumenty.asmx
> (UTF-8) I end up with an archive file containing instead of:
>
> Vrac� seznam koncov�ch
>
> Vrací seznam koncových
>
> I am not sure where start looking at the issue, can someone give me a
> pointer?
>
> The servers char-set claim is correctly utf8, I am running a debian
> system....
>
> thanks
>   Holger
>
